solution_line_template: 1 year has {months_per_year} months and his loan is for {loan_years} years so that's {months_per_year}*{loan_years} = <<{months_per_year}*{loan_years}={loan_months}>>{loan_months} months
His car payment is ${monthly_payment} a month for {loan_months} months so {monthly_payment}*{loan_months} = $<<{monthly_payment}*{loan_months}={total_loan_payment}>>{total_loan_payment}

He also put a down payment of ${down_payment} on the car so the total price of the car is ${down_payment} + ${total_loan_payment} = $<<{down_payment}+{total_loan_payment}={car_price}>>{car_price} car price
